alert.note: Alert for Donley; Gray; Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 26 at 6:14PM CST until February 26 at 7:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CST FOR WHEELER...SOUTHEASTERN GRAY...NORTHERN COLLINGSWORTH AND NORTHEASTERN DONLEY COUNTIES... At 614 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Mclean, or 18 miles west of Shamrock, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Shamrock, Wheeler, Mclean, Twitty, Lela, Alanreed and Kellerville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Blowing dust may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
